data.name: DisableSafeModeMessage
data.value:
It's strongly recommended not to move the "Program Files" or the "Program Files (x86)" directories as it can lead to unexpexted behaviour. You are free to move any of the programs contained in those directories without any problem instead.
Are you sure you want to disable safe mode?

data.name: ErrorUnauthorizedLink
data.value:
ERROR creating symbolic link. The folder is in the new position but the link could not be created. Try running as administrator
Do you want to move the files back?

data.name: ErrorUnauthorizedMoveDetails
data.value:
The error was caused by a file which couldn't be moved, it may be in use or you may not have the required permissions.
Try running this program as administrator and/or close any program that is using the file specified in the details
DETAILS:

data.name: ErrorUnauthorizedMoveMessage
data.value:
Error: {0}
How do you want to proceed? "Abort" to revert changes "Ignore" to stop the program

data.name: GitHubErrorMessage
data.value: Could not retrieve the version information from the GitHub server

data.name: IgnoreMessage
data.value:
Are you sure you want to proceed?
By ignoring you will leave all the files as they are now: part of the files will already be in the new location and missing from the old one!

data.name: IgnoreTextFile
data.value:
There was an error when moving the files using FreeMove on {0} and you chose to ignore it. The rest of the contents of this directory can be found at "{1}" unless they were moved. Next time use "Abort" in case of an error to move the files back or "Retry" to try again.
If this text file was useful or if you would have preferred it wasn't created let me know.

data.name: RemoveCopiedContentsFailed
data.value: Could not remove copied contents. Try removing manually

data.name: MoveBackFailedMessage
data.value: Could not move back contents. Try moving manually

data.name: UndoChangesDetailsQuestion
UndoChangesSimpleQuestion
data.value: Do you want to undo the changes?

data.name: CancelConfirmationMessage
data.value: Are you sure you want to cancel?

data.name: TooltipFrom
data.value: Select the folder you want to move

data.name: TooltipTo
data.value: Select where you want to move the folder

data.name: TooltipHidden
data.value: Select whether you want to hide the shortcut which is created in the old location or not

data.name: LanguageChangedRestartMessage
data.value: Language has been changed. The application will restart to apply the new language.

data.name: AdminRequiredMessage
data.value:
This application must be run as administrator in order to move folders and create junctions.
Please right-click the executable and choose "Run as administrator".

data.name: HelpContent
data.value:
FreeMove - Help
Move From: Select the folder you want to move (for example, a program folder under Program Files). To: Select the target location (for example, another drive) where you want to move the folder. Browse... Open a folder picker dialog to choose the source or target folder.
Move: Start moving the selected folder to the target location and create a junction at the original path. Close: Close the application window.
Set original folder to hidden: After moving, set the junction at the original location to Hidden so it is not visible in Explorer.
Create destination folder: If checked, FreeMove will create the target folder automatically when needed.
Settings → Check for update: - Check now: Manually check GitHub for a newer version. - Check on program start: If enabled, FreeMove will automatically check for updates when it starts.
Settings → Permission check: - None: Don't check any file before moving (fastest, but may fail later if permissions are missing). - Fast: Check .exe and .dll files before moving (default). - Full: Check all files before moving (slowest, but most thorough).
Settings → Safe mode: Prevents moving critical system folders (such as Program Files). It is strongly recommended to keep this enabled.
Info → Report an Issue: Open the GitHub page to report a bug or request a feature.
Info → GitHub: Open the project page on GitHub.
Info → About: Show information about FreeMove and its license.
Language: - English / Chinese: Switch the user interface language (the application will restart to apply the change).
